cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba and 300 mi SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move northwest, cross the northern Yucatan Peninsula late Monday, enter the central Gulf Tuesday, and approach the northern Gulf Coast (LA-MS vicinity) early Wednesday before moving inland toward the Tennessee Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Northern Yucatan Peninsula, Mexico (first landfall) then northern Gulf Coast, USA
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (system not forecast to track offshore of Boston, MA within 5-day window)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch/Warning confined to Yucatan Peninsula (Tulum to Rio Lagartos, incl. Cozumel).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for Pinar del Río, Cuba; Hurricane Warning for Yucatan Peninsula (Tulum–Rio Lagartos, Cozumel).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula, western Cuba, northern Gulf Coast (LA–MS–AL) and inland Southeast U.S.
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (Boston, MA not listed in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.first_hazard: None expected at Boston, MA in current forecast
weather_observation.wind: Minimal direct wind impact expected; any gusts late week would be from a weakened, post-tropical remnant and below gale force.
weather_observation.rainfall: Possible light to moderate rain as remnant low passes New England late week, but heavy tropical rainfall not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None identified for port operations during current 5-day forecast window.
